#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4 .
#Text=Conclusions and Limitations
#Text=The current study uses the mathematical principle of DP combined with empirical data to determine the demand functions for university football game tickets .
#Text=These estimated demand functions are fundamental for specifying a DP model .
#Text=Based on the calculated demand functions , it is established that the application of DP strategies would generate more revenues than the optimal fixed price .
#Text=Therefore , the study contributes to the existing literature by analyzing a pricing approach that is applicable in the field of online ticket sales .
#Text=The other important result of our study is the capacity distribution according to the game intensity .
#Text=It has been shown that it is not always optimal for a club to sell the entire capacity of tickets by itself .
#Text=Getting involved with a retailer can be beneficial if the club can earn a commission based on the sales from the retailer .
#Text=The results depict that for a high intensity game , the demand is generally high and thus the club should sell all the tickets by itself .
#Text=On the other hand , as the demand fluctuates the capacity allocation is an important factor and a hard mathematical problem for the club to maximize its revenues from ticket sales .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=. when the demand for tickets is relatively low , it is optimal for the club to retain 20 – 40 % of the tickets and the rest of the capacity should be sold to online retailers .

#Text=In the real world , this pricing technique has been used by football clubs and thus the secondary market online retailers like Ticketmaster and Vivid Seats have become popular in the last decade .
#Text=There are at some limitations to the present study .
#Text=First , only the ticket prices of games played by the university football team have been studied .
#Text=An evaluation of other sports clubs for different games in other leagues might reveal different demand functions , which are the core element of a DP model .
#Text=Thus , it seems advisable to repeat this study in a different context .
#Text=As mentioned in the introduction , several previous researches have pointed out to the fact that loyal fans are not always deterred by high ticket prices .
#Text=Due to this fact , several researchers have reported a positive correlation of game attendance with ticket prices .
#Text=Thus , a more robust data centric study considering all factors is required for further analysis .
#Text=The present dataset does not contain transactions on season tickets ; thus , the present study is limited to only individual transactions .

#Text=As is evident , teams tend to hold on to their season ticket holders by offering a lower price ; a future study involving season ticket transactions and DP is required to find the optimal fixed price for season tickets .
#Text=Furthermore , the estimated demand functions for five games rely on a small sample data set .
#Text=Hence , future research could extend the findings from the current study by analyzing a larger data set involving multiple teams and multiple games .
#Text=Second , the designed DP model is based on only five demand functions , one for each home game played by the university .
#Text=This study considers the home game as high ranked based on its previous performances .
#Text=However , if the home game is either medium or low ranked then at least nine different demand functions need to be considered for all game types .
#Text=This would provide a more detailed analysis of how the capacity distribution of tickets should be allocated by the club to maximize its revenues .

#Text=However , one reason the DP strategy for pricing sports tickets has been studied extensively is due to interest in different kinds of factors , such as current position in the league standings or weather conditions , in order to price the tickets .
#Text=These factors have not been considered in the present study .
#Text=Finally , the present study considers only one type of seats for simplicity for pricing the tickets .
#Text=Prices for different zones and seat types may yield different result in terms of distribution of the capacity .
#Text=However , the main result of DP for generating maximum revenues should not change when different seat types are considered .
#Text=Finally , the study has been done from the perspective of the home team club .
#Text=The main objective is to maximize the revenue of the club from online ticket sales through third-party retailers .
#Text=A further scope of research would be to consider sales from both the club and the retailer ’s perspective and maximize the revenue of the supply chain .
#Text=The online retailer might not be able to sell all the tickets , in which case a salvage value can be considered if the ticket is unsold .
#Text=Thus , the retailer will have a differentiated strategy and the overall supply chain needs to be considered for the benefit of the club and the online retailer .
